WorkItem.ClosedComment: User needed to reset all caches
WorkItem.Description:
I receive an error when selecting the Reset button in the Filter Items by Source window. Also, there are no listed sorts by default.
 
Edit. I fail at using the reporting template. I was using the most current release 4.16, via Chrome.
 
I have performed the Suggested Fix and continue to receive this error. If I am posting this message without having performed the Suggested Fix I am aware that I am consuming the Developer(s) time in managing my Issue unnecessarily.
 
== Error Message ==
[NoElements]
Arguments: 
Debugging resource strings are unavailable. Often the key and arguments provide sufficient information to diagnose the problem. See http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=106663&Version=4.0.51204.0&File=System.Core.dll&Key=NoElements
 
== StackTrace ==
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.Last[TSource](IEnumerable`1 source)
   at Rawr.UI.GraphDisplay.SourceFilters_Helper(Boolean Checked, Boolean Reset)
   at Rawr.UI.GraphDisplay.BT_SourceFilters_Reset_Click(Object sender, RoutedEventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.OnClick()
   at System.Windows.Controls.Button.OnClick()
   at System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.OnMouseLeftButtonUp(MouseButtonEventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Controls.Control.OnMouseLeftButtonUp(Control ctrl, EventArgs e)
   at MS.Internal.JoltHelper.FireEvent(IntPtr unmanagedObj, IntPtr unmanagedObjArgs, Int32 argsTypeIndex, Int32 actualArgsTypeIndex, String eventName)
 
== These are the Steps that I have tried ==
There were no suggested fixes. I have forced a reload in the browser as well as trying Chrome, Firefox and IE.
 
To create the problem, I went to http://elitistjersks.com/rawr.php and did not load a model. I selected Filters, then the Filters by Source and selected Reset to see if that would populate the list witht he default sorts. At this point, I received the error.
 
using the latest web release, which I believe is 4.16.
WorkItem.Summary: [ItemFilters] Item Filter by Source Reset throws error

Comments.Message: What do you mean there are no default sorts? You mentioned that inside the text file as well and I'm guessing you are using the word incorrectly.
The NoElements statement tells me that the Filters Tree is empty, which means you need to go to Options > Reset All Caches

Your second post is the proper phrasing for the issue. The Filters Tree is empty. Reset all cache worked after forcing a refresh of the app. Thanks for your assistance. My apologies if I missed the instruction on when to clear cache on one of the pages.
